DataElement.preferredName: Iris Uveal Melanoma AJCC Edition 8 Pathologic Tumor T Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the primary iris melanoma based on clinical stage information combined with operative findings, and evidence obtained from pathology review when surgery is the first definitive therapy, using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Iris Uveal Melanoma Pathologic T Category
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The colored disc of the eye composed of connective tissue, epithelium, and endothelium. It separates the anterior chamber from the posterior chamber._A melanoma derived from melanocytes of the uveal tract.  It is the most common primary intraocular tumor in the United States and Western Europe.  Similar to melanoma of the skin, it is rare in Africa and Asia.  Diagnostic procedures include ophthalmoscopic exam, fluorescein angiography and ultrasound.  Treatment includes: surgical excision of the eye, iridocyclectomy and tumor resection.  Recent treatments also include radiotherapy or photo coagulation.  Classification of uveal melanomas recognizes four cell types within these tumors: epithelioid, intermediate, mixed cell, and spindle cell types.  The spindle cell type uveal melanomas are further sub-classified as spindle cell type A and spindle cell type B._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The colored disc of the eye composed of connective tissue, epithelium, and endothelium. It separates the anterior chamber from the posterior chamber.:A melanoma derived from melanocytes of the uveal tract.  It is the most common primary intraocular tumor in the United States and Western Europe.  Similar to melanoma of the skin, it is rare in Africa and Asia.  Diagnostic procedures include ophthalmoscopic exam, fluorescein angiography and ultrasound.  Treatment includes: surgical excision of the eye, iridocyclectomy and tumor resection.  Recent treatments also include radiotherapy or photo coagulation.  Classification of uveal melanomas recognizes four cell types within these tumors: epithelioid, intermediate, mixed cell, and spindle cell types.  The spindle cell type uveal melanomas are further sub-classified as spindle cell type A and spindle cell type B.

Concepts.longName: Iris
Concepts.definition: The colored disc of the eye composed of connective tissue, epithelium, and endothelium. It separates the anterior chamber from the posterior chamber.

Concepts.longName: Uveal Melanoma
Concepts.definition: A melanoma derived from melanocytes of the uveal tract.  It is the most common primary intraocular tumor in the United States and Western Europe.  Similar to melanoma of the skin, it is rare in Africa and Asia.  Diagnostic procedures include ophthalmoscopic exam, fluorescein angiography and ultrasound.  Treatment includes: surgical excision of the eye, iridocyclectomy and tumor resection.  Recent treatments also include radiotherapy or photo coagulation.  Classification of uveal melanomas recognizes four cell types within these tumors: epithelioid, intermediate, mixed cell, and spindle cell types.  The spindle cell type uveal melanomas are further sub-classified as spindle cell type A and spindle cell type B.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

Concepts.longName: Pathologic
Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.

Concepts.longName: T Category
Concepts.definition: One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 9-6-19 TMT released per MC.; 12/10/18 tmt created for standardization.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Iris Uveal Melanoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 T Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The colored disc of the eye composed of connective tissue, epithelium, and endothelium. It separates the anterior chamber from the posterior chamber._A finding about one or more characteristics of uveal melanoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This classification system applies to malignant melanoma of the iris, ciliary body, and choroid. Cutaneous melanoma metastatic to the iris, ciliary body, and choroid is staged according to the classification for melanoma of the skin and secondary intraocular extension of conjunctival melanoma is staged according to the classification for conjunctival melanoma. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion)._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Iris Melanoma pT4b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Iris Melanoma pT4b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Iris melanoma with extrascleral extension more than 5 mm in largest diameter. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Iris Melanoma pT4b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Iris melanoma with extrascleral extension more than 5 mm in largest diameter. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Iris melanoma with extrascleral extension 5 mm or less in largest diameter. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Iris Melanoma pT3 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Iris melanoma with tumor confluent with or extending into the ciliary body, choroid, or both, with scleral extension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Iris Melanoma pT3 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Iris melanoma with tumor confluent with or extending into the ciliary body, choroid, or both, with scleral extension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)
